snippet: A federal judge on Thursday struck down Ohio’s law barring people from knowingly or recklessly making false statements about candidates in a case that the United States Supreme Court said needed to be heard.
abstract: Federal Judge Timothy Black strikes down Ohio’s law barring people from knowingly or recklessly making false statements about candidates in a case that the United States Supreme Court said needed to be heard.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Thursday struck down Ohio’s law barring people from knowingly or recklessly making false statements about candidates in a case that the United States Supreme Court said needed to be heard.

headline.main: Ohio: Law Against Lies Is Nullified
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Law Against Lies Is Nullified
